intro: Ramischia, commonly known as the "sunshine flower," is a genus of flowering plants native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the summer. Ramischia species are often found in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to full sun exposure. Due to their ornamental value, some species are cultivated in gardens for their vibrant blooms and hardy nature.
